item.description:
Mr. Wiggles and I are more than ready for a nice walk on a mild day!!

Come join us at the Southern New England Trunkline Trail. Background about the trail indicates that early 1900s entrepreneur who was a driving force behind the proposed rail road was on the Titanic and did not survive the ships’ sinking.  The rail line project died with him and construction was not completed. 

We will go long enough to get a good workout and enjoy the mild weather.

The trail is usually gravel and dirt, but of course will be snow covered with hopefully minimal ice. Please plan accordingly. Stabilizers are a good addition, available at most sports stores and I believe even Wal-Mart.

Please bring plenty of water and a snack. Change of socks and shoes probably a good idea as well. We will head for local late lunch after for those who wish.

Directions: Please see attached map below or under "More" tab - "Files. You can take 495 exits 16 or 17. The parking lot is located on Grove St. between Route 140 and Pulanski Blvd. If you mapquest it will take you to a different location further down the trail.

In case you need to reach me 508-415-0590.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in parking lot next to trail. Set off from road a bit, but good signage. This will be Grove St.
item.name: Walk/Hike at Southern New England Trunkline Trail, Franklin MA
